item.title: Twitter's New Retweet With Comment Counter Is Now Available On Andriod and Web
item.altTitle: Now you can see how many people retweeted your tweet with a comment too
item.content: Last week, Twitter rolled out a new feature to iOS, where you can see the number of times your tweet has been retweeted with a comment, now it is available on Android and iOS.

item.title: Microsoft returns to Java with Azure-focused OpenJDK release
item.altTitle: It’s been a long time since Microsoft brewed its own Java. But now it’s back, with the Microsoft Build of OpenJDK, fit and finished for running in the Azure cloud.
item.content: A build of OpenJDK 11 is already available in the Azure Cloud Shell, so you can use it with jshell to try out code snippets.

item.title: Gradle 7.0 improves incremental builds, backs Java 16
item.altTitle: New release of the build automation tool also improves support for Apple Silicon systems.
item.content: With the Gradle 7.0 release, introduced April 9, file system watching is enabled by default, to make incremental builds quicker. The capability was introduced as an opt-in feature in Gradle 6.5 and deemed production-ready in Gradle 6.7.

item.title: 6 reasons to switch to managed Kubernetes
item.altTitle: Managed Kubernetes services have matured to the point where many enterprises are handing over the keys to their clusters.
item.content: Kubernetes starting to use all three major cloud vendors for managed workloads where appropriate.
